abstracts.cdata!:
The Third National Railway Project for
            China had an overall satisfactory outcome, with both the
            Bank's and the borrower's performances being
            deemed satisfactory. Of the three project development
            objectives indicators, two indicators were fully achieved,
            while the third indicator was achieved to a large extent.
            The significant lessons learned during the implementation of
            the project are: 1) bidding for civil works contracts of
            such complexity should be done based on detailed designs and
            construction drawings rather than on preliminary design; 2)
            the practice of basing task team leaders in the
            borrower's country should be encouraged; 3) managing
            resettlement of project-affected persons by provincial
            governments who were not parties to the loan agreement
            created a risk for delay in implementation; 4) the use of an
            independent environmental compliance monitor proved its
            value in the project, ensuring that proper attention was
            paid to environmental safeguards while freeing the
            supervising engineer to concentrate on technical issues; 5)
            the borrower's project management should be encouraged
            to make a useful contribution to project-affected
            communities by handing over to them facilities that are no
            longer needed, once the project is completed; and 6)
            sustained sector dialogue in parallel to project
            implementation can sometimes be more influential than
            including all technical assistance in the project.

repnme.cdata!: China - Third National Railway Project : restructuring

abstracts.cdata!:
The development objective of the Third
            National Railway Project is to assist China in expanding the
            capacity of its railway system to meet the growing demand
            for transport of people and goods between Guizhou and Yunnan
            provinces. The closing date of the project will be extended
            by one year from June 30, 2012 to June 30, 2013. The
            extension is needed to complete the remaining civil works
            contract and complete related contract expenditures. As the
            loan is approaching closure, it is requested that a
            reallocation of funds between categories be undertaken to
            move remaining funds in categories where expenditures are
            complete or nearing completion to the works category where
            the civil works is still under construction. Nonetheless,
            the request to reallocate between loan categories and extend
            the closing date does constitute a level two restructuring
            in accordance with the Bank's operational memoranda.

display_title.display_title:
China - Third National Railway
            Project : restructuring (Vol. 2) : Data sheet
